intro: Pouzolzia indica var. alienata, commonly known as the Indian pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
